cluster_relations.rel_desc: The types of body language represent a categorization scheme applied to body language.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a categorization scheme or set of types used to classify instances or subtypes of the object concept.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Scope: conceptual taxonomy of body language forms

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Frowns are categorized as facial expressions.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a more specific type or subtype within the category denoted by the object.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a set of types or a classification scheme specifically used to categorize instances or subtypes of the object concept.
args.justification: The relation links 'types of body language' (a set of categories) to 'body language' (the overall concept). The existing canonical_rel_name 'categorizes' is vague about direction, whereas 'is_classification_scheme_for' clearly encodes that the subject is the scheme and the object is the conceptual domain being classified. The existing rel_cls and rel_cls_group appropriately capture that this is a hierarchical taxonomy-style relation, so only the predicate label and its description are refined for clarity and directionality.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a set of types or a classification scheme specifically used to categorize instances or subtypes of the object concept.
executed_decisions.justification: The relation links 'types of body language' (a set of categories) to 'body language' (the overall concept). The existing canonical_rel_name 'categorizes' is vague about direction, whereas 'is_classification_scheme_for' clearly encodes that the subject is the scheme and the object is the conceptual domain being classified. The existing rel_cls and rel_cls_group appropriately capture that this is a hierarchical taxonomy-style relation, so only the predicate label and its description are refined for clarity and directionality.
